results.name: Number of ordered pairs (x,y) of positive integers such that x^2 + y^2 = n.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: G.f.: (theta_3(q) - 1)^2/4, where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 08 2018
mathematica: nn = 100; t = Table[0, {nn}]; s = Sqrt[nn]; Do[n = x^2 + y^2; If[n <= nn, t[[n]]++], {x, s}, {y, s}]; Join[{0}, t] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 03 2011 *)
program: sum $ map (a010052 . (n -)) $ takeWhile (< n) $ tail a000290_list
(PARI) a(n)=if(n==0, return(0)); my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f~, if(f[i, 1]%4==1, f[i, 2]+1, f[i, 2]%2==0 || f[i, 1]==2)) - issquare(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 18 2016
xref: Cf. A000404 (the numbers n that can be represented in this form).
